m_szDocTitle: Rebate program aims to support clean vehicles in Nebraska | Hydrogen Fuel News
m_szDocSumamry: Categorized | Featured News , Transportation , United States Rebate program aims to support clean vehicles in Nebraska Share on Tumblr Nebraska Energy Office launches new rebate program for clean vehicles Nebraska has launched a new rebate program that aims to support the adoption of clean vehicles. Called the Clean-Burning Motor Fuel Development Debate Program, the state hopes that it will encourage more consumers to purchase vehicles that produce no harmful emissions, or those that produce limited emissions. The program is funded through state law and is managed by the Nebraska Energy Office
